alert.note: Alert for Northern Franklin; Northern St. Lawrence; Southwestern St. Lawrence (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 24 at 3:05AM EST until January 25 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM EST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Snow and freezing rain expected. Additional snow accumulations of up to one inch for a storm total of up to three inches and ice accumulations of two to four tenths of an inch. * WHERE...St. Lawrence Valley and northern Franklin County of New York. * WHEN...Until 7 AM EST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Power outages and tree damage are possible due to the ice. Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning and evening commutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Ongoing snow will lead to a slippery commute this morning. After a brief lull midday, precipitation returns as freezing rain Wednesday evening and continues into early Thursday morning before tapering off by midday.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Please allow extra time if travel is necessary. Remember that it only takes a glaze of ice to create hazardous travel conditions.

area.areaDesc: Northern Franklin; Northern St. Lawrence; Southwestern St. Lawrence
